sen.j: 尾崎弥兵衛（おざきやへえ、生没年不詳）は新選組の前身、壬生浪士組の隊士である。
sen.e: Yahe-e OZAKI (years of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Miburoshigumi (Mibu masterless warriors group) which was the forerunner of the Shinsengumi (literally, the newly selected corps, referring to a special police force for the Tokugawa regime).

Yahei OZAKI (years of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Miburoshigumi (Mibu masterless warriors group) which was the forerunner of the Shinsengumi (literally, the newly selected corps, referring to a special police force for the Tokugawa regime).

Yahei OZAKI (years of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Miburoshigumi (Mibu masterless warriors group) which was the forerunner of the Shinsengumi (literally, the newly selected corps, referring to a special police force for the Tokugawa regime).

sen.j: 文久3年5月頃（1863年6月～7月）に入隊し、同月25日（1863年7月10日）の「幕府提出上書署名者一覧」に名前がある。
sen.e: Yahe-e joined the Miburoshigumi in around June or July, 1863, as his name appeared in a 'List of Signers for Official Documents Submitted to the Shogunate' ('Bakufu Teishutsu Josho Shomeisha Ichiran' in Japanese) which was dated July 10, 1863.
sen.cmt: 文末「あるが」を「ある。」と修正しました。また、原文に西暦日付を補足しました。http://keisan.casio.jp/has10/SpecExec.cgi

sen.j: しかし、同年七月（1863年8月～9月）の「在隊者リスト」には名前がない。
sen.e: However, Yahe-e's name was not included in a 'List of Active-Duty Troops' which was created in August or September, 1863.
sen.cmt: 原文文頭に「しかし、」を補足しました。また、原文に西暦日付を補足しました。http://keisan.casio.jp/has11/SpecExec.cgi

sen.j: この事でそれ以前に離隊したとも考えられるが、永倉新八の「同士連名記」にて尾関弥兵衛としており、事によっては、尾関弥四郎と同一人物とも考えられる。
sen.e: This may be because Yahe-e retired somewhere before then, but Shinpachi NAGAKURA's "Doshi Renmei Ki" (literally, the "Record of the Fellow Troops' Names") included an alleged name of him, Yahe-e OZEKI, who may possibly be identical with Yashiro OZEKI.

This may be because Yahei retired somewhere before then, but Shinpachi NAGAKURA's "Doshi Renmei Ki" (literally, the "Record of the Fellow Troops' Names") included an alleged name of him, Yahei OZEKI, who may possibly be identical with Yashiro OZEKI.

This may be because Yahei retired somewhere before then, but Shinpachi NAGAKURA's "Doshi Renmei Ki" (literally, the "Record of the Fellow Troops' Names") included an alleged name of him, Yahei OZEKI, who may possibly be identical with Yashiro OZEKI.

sen.j: もしそうならば、 慶応元年11月7日（1865年12月24日）に病死している。
sen.e: If so (i.e. if Yahe-e was identical with Yashiro OZEKI), he died of an illness on December 24, 1865.
